thread.section_title: Yahoo! Finance: Property Management Industry News
thread.title: Rouse Properties reports 2Q results

title: Rouse Properties reports 2Q results
text:
Rouse Properties reports 2Q results Rouse Properties posts 2Q FFO of $22.4 million, results miss profit expectations 5 hours ago Content preferences Done 
NEW YORK (AP) _ Rouse Properties Inc. (RSE) on Monday reported a key measure of profitability in its second quarter. The results did not meet Wall Street expectations. 
The real estate investment trust, based in New York, said it had funds from operations of $22.4 million, or 39 cents per share, in the period. 
The average estimate of four analysts surveyed by Zacks Investment Research was for funds from operations of 40 cents per share. 
Funds from operations is a closely watched measure in the REIT industry. It takes net income and adds back items such as depreciation and amortization. 
The company said it had a loss of $688,000, or 1 cent per share. 
The regional mall real estate investment trust posted revenue of $72.4 million in the period. 
Rouse Properties expects full-year funds from operations to be $1.74 to $1.78 per share. 
The company's shares have declined 6 percent since the beginning of the year. In the final minutes of trading on Monday, shares hit $17.38, a climb of 2 percent in the last 12 months.
